reviews.review_msg: This instructor is extremely difficult . His second year Social Movements class at Douglas is more like a third or fourth year class. New students beware. Marks down if you are in class and every time you participate... very structured. Long and dry lectures. Nice enough person.

He was the best prof at SFU and I am so sad that he does not teach here anymore!! Very knowledgable about sociology and his passion reflects on his students. Keeps everything engaging and interesting. Clear assignments and always available for feedback. Seriously one amazing dude and I would recommend taking his course in a heartbeat!!!!
Best prof I had at SFU and an amazing person.

Great prof to take for an early sociology class. His explanations of complicated concepts are accessable and his lectures detailed. Can sometimes go on tangents, but if you're a proficient note-taker, there's no way to fail this class.

SA150 NOW/ Straightforward slides, no laptops, gives layouts for MT/ Finals, not afraid to veer off topic to discuss tangential information while being PC but also expressive. Participation marks  asking questions in class. Lectures reflect textbook chapters with a little extra
extremely tough grader, dont take his course if you want good grades

I loved his class. The material are dry and there is a lot of readings but if you like the subject like I did, you will enjoy the class and for sure can learn a lot. I think he is fair  , interesting and great ! doesn't have power points but its better to take as much notes as you can. Be sure to stick to his syllabus described requirements !

Excellent instructor. Lectures and explains concepts well and with great clarity. He is very interested in the subject that he teaches, and he relates well with students. I appreciated how open-minded and easy going he is. His classes are a great platform for sharing and debating ideas. Pay attention in class and participate in every lecture.

I loved his classes. Lectures are engaging, work for the class is fair and so is marking. and he is quite the looker. He communicates the material very well. I've taken 2 classes with him and I hope to take more. Highly recommended for SA 250 and 350. he makes theory fun and applicable to present day.

He clearly has a passion for what he teaches and his lectures were very informative. I disagreed with a lot of the course material and the individuals that we studied and it seemed more philosophically-oriented.

This prof knows what he is talking about,very engaged in the content and is really helpful. He is able to meet quite often for help and takes into consideration the concerns of the class. He issued a mid-term evaluation of himself so that he could improve.He's hard marker but when you get a good mark, you feel great, because you know its great work

Jakub is able to clearly and thoroughly present material in an engaging fashion and maintain an environment conducive to questions and discussion. He is receptive to student ideas and input and tries to minimize the hierarchy in the classroom setting. If you can take a course with Jakub, do it.

Very engaging in class. You can tell he has a passion for what he is teaching. I do think he had some unreasonable expectations regarding the amount of reading he required. Sometimes he was struggled to keep his expectations at a undergrad level.

He is interesting and definitely knows his theory. He is open to debates and had great discussions in class. Not an easy marker and definitely makes you work for it. However there are only two assignments (no exams).
